Reviews.Title: “Under the bridge is a better option”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: How on earth this one could claim 3 stars? This hotel is so below basic sanitary norms that I am surprised it still survives. The only explanation would be people confusing it with the other Cavendish (in Mayfair) and booking in this disgrace of a hotel service. No lift. This really should be written on their website in big bold red. Single room is not big enough to fit a suitcase. Obviously the personnel of this hotel thinks that suitcases are living beings, so they will walk upstairs on their own, and if you are travelling with a suitcase you should book a double. Audibility is great – you can hear everything your neighbors are doing! I certainly could appreciate traditional folk singing outside at 3 a.m. in the morning. It was too cold to sleep, anyway - the heater in my room was not working. To get it working, you should go to reception and ask – they will switch it on for you for a couple of hours. This is not something that I gladly do in the middle of the night. Blanket in the room had no changeable cover over it. It was DIRTY. The carpet on the floor was DIRTY. I was staying there for 6 nights and the room was not cleaned even once. I wonder if they know how to use a vacuum cleaner at all. Once I dropped something on the floor and had to look under the table to pick it up. I wish I had not. There was no hot water in the shower – only warm (kind of). It does take 10 minutes to rinse off shampoo from your hair because the water is barely streaming. Shower cabin is for S size people only. If you are wearing M – you will not fit in there. If you are L, you will not be able to make it to the bathroom at all. One brilliant morning reception called me to inform that the shower in my room is leaking on the floor below. I bet this happens with them on regular basis. On their website their advertise “free high speed wifi”. This does not exist. Computer detects variety of connections like HotelCavendish, Hotel Cavendish, HotelCavendish1, Hotel Cavendish 1a, HotelCavendish1a but none of them works. Don't ask me why I stayed there for that long, ok? Just do not repeat this mistake yourself. And price-wise: single room was 80 per night. In Travelodge Covent Garden (where I typically stay when coming on my own) you can get double for 70 if you book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “fair value but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: alaskahen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not 4 star by my standards! It is convenient and our room was quiet (as requested) at the back. The front is on a main road. As for being re-furbished as claimed I saw no evidence as the public areas were worn and our room, although very clean, was tatty. The shower took 15 minutes to run even lukewarm and the hair dryer didn't work. The staff were helpful but when we needed breakfast early (7 am) to catch a train all we could get was cardboard toast. We booked this room late and with a deal it was just worth the money but I wouldn't want to pay full price for it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: StephS3624
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cavendish in May - beautiful hotel - very modern, clean, beds were really comfortable -great location for shopping, restaurants and easy access to all sights - very safe area - would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rather go under a bridge”
Reviews.Author: Atticusbcn
Reviews.Content: Tiny and dirty rooms. Worn out curtains, made from the same piece as the sheets. Stained walls. Cables hanging from the walls. Windows that did not close properly (in February!). Old low-quality matrassess. My bathroom was not cleaned in 3 days. I received a phone call at 3am from the reception desk asking me if I had been to a party that night and had not paid for a taxi (I even had to go downstairs wearing my pijama to explain the cop I had been in bed since 10pm!). Oh, yes, breakfast was suprisingly good!

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for space”
Reviews.Author: EssexHonesty
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were told we were on the 2nd floor - there was no one to help with our suitcases but luckily we are able to carry these ourselves as our room was up 4 flights of stairs. The room was very small and the bed a queen size. The ledge of the one bedside cabinet we had (your couldn't fit one the other side of the bed as it was up against the window) kept my partner awake alnight as he kept hitting himself. The coffee in the room was awful. Breakfast was okay but down some steep stairs in what would have been the cellar. The carpet at the top of the first flight of stairs from the reception was loose and could cause a bad accident.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: marie e
Reviews.Content: I was on the lower ground floor, it was smelly, noisy and the beds were really uncomfortable...worst night sleep

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in London.....”
Reviews.Author: Odila1
Reviews.Content: If you like to go back to basics, this is the place to be: tiny rooms (max width 2m), lukewarm water only and the shower has no water pressure so it takes about 15 minutes to rinse your hair. No hairdryer that works, no lift, no comfort, lots of funny smells, traffic noise 24/7 and you can hear everything your neighbour does. If you want all this, please go ahead and book. If you wish to stay in a real hotel: please reconsider and try something else. Definitely not somewhere where I want to go ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to invest or reduce its prices”
Reviews.Author: kingfisherh
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for 3 adults and ended up with a double bed and a pull out sofa which was unbearable and should have been thrown out years ago. There was only 2 cups. The breakfasts that came were not what we ordered and the waitresses struggled to understand. The room was very expensive for what we got. We would not go back

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Iain Y
Reviews.Content: On walking into my room I thought I had gone into the broom closet by accident. There was just room for a 6 foot bed no room for me and my bag in what little floor space was left. The shower stank of dampness and had the musky smell of a room left without any ventilation. The extractor was not working and found it had been switched off at the master switch. On turning it back on and using the bathroom at 4am found out why it had been switched off. If I woke my neighbour in the next rook I apologise. There was black mould on the wall of the shower, the cable for computer access was broken and had been like that for sometime as someone had repaired it was black masking tape and the repair was so old that the tape had lost all stickiness. The blinds in the room wear badly worn as was thread bear stair carpet. The hotel advertises cable television I could only find three channels which is less that you can get from free to air. Did report the faults and the receptionist on checking out was dismayed they had not been fixed. Would not recommend this hotel but have stayed in worse.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor, would never recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: FlissCornwall
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on business in October, and was never so glad to leave. The hotel is dirty, the room standard is below that of a two star and the staff are indifferent if not ignorant, using the 'we don't understand' card constantly. The room considering the cost of the hotel is very small and the bathroom the size of a cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “An Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tony Y
Reviews.Content: I got an awful experience from staying in this hotel in September 2011. I was totally shock by the size and the hygiene conditions of the room in this so called â€œ4-starâ€� hotel. The room was very small and dirty. There were unpleasant smells from the bed and strains were found on the mattress and bed sheet cover. Ants were found crawling on the floors. The biggest mistake I made this time was that I had not read the guest reviews before booking for this hotel located at Gower Street. The extremely poor comments made by other reviewers on this hotel were true. It was not exaggerated for some of them to classify this hotel as a B&B or a hostel. The facilities and hygiene conditions of the hotel were far beyond the reasonable expectation from an average guest. It was an insult to the wisdom of guests if this â€œhotelâ€� still called it a â€œ4-star hotelâ€�, or even a â€œhotelâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: The room is very very very small. There are no table, chair and rubbish provided in the room. Stains and smells were found on the bed sheets and matress. It was shame for it to claim as 4-star hotel. The condition is just a B&B accommodation rather than a hotel. It was the most terrible "hotel" I have seen so far.

Reviews.Title: “Total rip-off”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Grubby, worn out and patched up. This hotel offers itself as a 4 star. It should be prosecuted under the trades description act! Let's start with a good point... The staff are friendly! That's it! The rooms are grubby, the carpets are worn out and I would not give it anything more than a 1 star. If you stay on the 3rd floor the internet doesn't work. The bathroom is a cupboard with broken floor tiles and very small. I now know why they take the payment before you get the room. No one would pay! Oh... and no air-con the only con is the price!

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. Overpriced, poor staff, tiny bedroom, no hot water. If anyone who has stayed here can write a good review, then they have very low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: t l
Reviews.Content: From the moment of our check-in by joe,our break was superb.I have never felt a nicer atmosphere in a hotel.The food and service in the restaurant was wonderful,the personal service from carlos was very much appreciated.the breakfasts were without doubt some of the best i have ever had in a hotel.I am looking forward to returning with my family.Even though we were on "break rate" the staff never made us feel anything other than warmly welcome...........would reccomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “This hotel just doesn't care”
Reviews.Author: DarthVertigo
Reviews.Content: Our story is too long to go into. The short version is that we dropped our bags in our room, went to a movie theater the desk clerk recommended only to find the theater was closed (no special reason - just regular business hours the clerk should have known and told us about), then returned to the hotel to find that we were locked out of our room. Long story short, it took an hour to get into the room and the help of a clerk from another hotel to get us into the room. My wife, who was getting sick anyway, sat in a hallway that was inexcusably hot while we kept trying to get into the room. All the while we totally kept our calm, though we were both getting upset. We got into the room, again, which was just way too hot for anybody's comfort (there was a single fan blowing in the lobby, the main door was wide open to let the summer heat inside, and no A/C). The next morning, I calmly explained that I believed our inconvenience the previous night was unacceptable and merited a discount. I asked for 20% off, which I felt was more than fair, given that I actually wanted to ask for half off. I was told to come back and speak to the booking manager who would be in later that morning. I did so, and was told it would be taken care of. We stayed there in the middle of July, it is now the end of August. We received our credit card bill, and were charged the full amount for the room. I have contacted them twice (repeating my detailed explanation of our problem) to correct this and receive the 20% discount we were promised, and have still heard no reply of any kind. You should also be aware that the rooms are inexcusably small. I am 6'4" tall - the room itself is exactly that wide, and maybe 5 feet long ... two people can indeed fit in the bed, but not comfortably (especially when it's hot) and there is absolutely no room to move around in. It's you, the bed, and your bags. You can't even see the floor. All that for over 100 GBP. If you're looking for a hotel in London, keep looking. Don't bother with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: steve_g9981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no way a 4 star hotel. I would rate it 1 star! The room I was given was like a prison cell! It was tiny I couldnt move around without having to get into an awkward position. The TV aerial was on top of the wardrobe with taped up wires and zilch reception! The suposedly updated room was dreadful with stained carpets, fraid bedlining, dated broken furniture and broken window! The bathroom was tiny and the lack of towels and toiletries made it even more uncomfortable! I booked this room for 4 nights and immediatley complained! The Desk staff said they had no other rooms left and so I immediately went back up and connected to the hotels sloooooowwww internet to book myself a room at a different hotel! This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Poor room, poor location, good breakfast - not a good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kashpir_pl
Reviews.Content: I spent few nights at Cavendish Hotel during a business trip. It's an old building accomodated for a hotel needs. I stayed at one of the single rooms - and it was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. To open the suitcase I had to lay it on the bed, otherwise no chance to do that. The bathroom is quite like a room itself - tiny, tiny, tiny, however it was clean. The good thing was the breakfast, which was quite tasty (Polish staff in kitchen). The guys at the reception - met 3 of them, one not quite hospitable, 2 others seemed communicative. The location is poor as in the close neighbourhood there are practically no restaurants. Overall, stay in a single room cannot be recommended - especially for the price we paid, which was Â£125 per night. Look elsewhere if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: GrahamandMary
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel looking for budget accomodation in London. Booked two rooms as our party was my wife and myseld plus my 77 year old mother who has moblity issues. Hence a double room and a single room which give rise to slightly different experiences. The overall hotel is superbly positioned for the West End, particularly the British Museum and positioned directly between Euston Station and the Museum - easily walkable. It is an old substantial house which has been converted, hence there are a lot of stairs to reach rooms, but banisters allow impaired mobility access but not for someone who can not leave their wheel chair for short ditances. Reception is 24 hours and they were happy to have luggage left with them prior to checkout and after checkout, so that you can continue with your visit to London without dragging bags with you. The double room was clean and reasonably sized (room 103) at the front of the hotel. The small double bed was comfortable with clean sheets - I needed a second pillow as the ones on the bed were a little tired but this was supplied in the wardrobe complete with clean pillow case. Complimentry tea and coffee making facilites had plenty of supplies. The shower room had a high step to walk into it but it was again clean, plently of towels although they were a little thin together with bars of soap and shampoo were provided. It was a little noisy at times during the night as heavy traffic passed by. There was a small wall mounted flat screen TV with freeview diital channels and free wifi. Overall, for a Â£125 central London room, including a cooked breakfast - this room left a good impression. The single room was not as good. Room 104 had a single bed which covered the entire width of the room and was against the outside window wall. No curtains - just a pull down blind (in contrast with the nicly curtained 103). The flat screen TV had only an internal ariel in the room and was unwatchable. The bed occupied the room at its widest point and after a couple of feet into the room, the width narrowed to about half the length of the bed where it accomodated the ensuite shower room. This was perfectly adequate and of the same standard as the one in the double room. Overall, clean but very small, and with the bed pressed against the outside wall, quite noisy. The cooked breakfast was served in a room in the basement, not enough tables to accomodated everyone at once but turnover meant that this was not a real issue. the food quality was excellent with english breakfast consisting of bacon, sausage, tomato, beans and a choice of eggs. Cereal, fruit juices, fruit and yoghurt were vailable for self service. Toast was automatically brought to the table and the coffee cafetierre was refilled without needing to be asked. Staff were very good and friendly. Overall, had this reviewer only seen the double room, a strong review would have been given but I would not want that single one again although, in fairness it was a Â£105 cntral London one with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “The GOWER STREET Cavendish”
Reviews.Author: Mancunian111
Reviews.Content: We booked the Gower Street Cavendish by mistake. We have stayed at the Jermyn Street Cavendish before - which is excellent - but I had not been paying attention when the search engine pointed me towards Gower Street instead. I was not aware than another "Cavendish" existed, so had just assumed I was booking Jermyn Street. All my fault I know - that will teach me to be more careful next time. Caveat emptor. Wife and I arrived late Friday night (11pm, 22nd July 2011) for a 3 night stay booked on-line. Was told it was "policy" to pay for all three nights in advance. I explained that that advance payment was not my "policy", and I would pay as and when I checked out. Once I had seen the (basement) room allocated (and we slept on top of the bedding) I told the receptionist that we would be checking out the following morning. It was too late at night for us to leave on the Friday night given the time of arrival, so there was no practical alternative. Obviously there is no need to elaborate on the heartfelt comments of other reviewers - the "hotel" is simply a disgrace. So, we checked out on the Saturday morning having settled for 1 night on my Mastercard, and booked another Hotel for the remaining two nights. Back home on Monday and messages on my phone from my Bank. Two fraudulent transactions on my Mastercard on the Saturday evening. Coincidence? Maybe/maybe not. I will be referring this "Hotel" to Trading Standards (their web site is a scandalous misrepresentation of their "Hotel"), Mastercard will be investigating the security of their Chip and Pin operation, and I have asked the "real" Cavendish to consider the damage their Bloomsbury namesake is causing to their brand. I have made the Gower Street Cavendish aware of what I will be doing. Thinking of staying at the Gower Street Cavendish? Just don't. The Jermyn Street Cavendish is excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “Refused to stay”
Reviews.Author: RJ647
Reviews.Content: Booked via the internet description sounded OK. Arrived and my wife refused to stay. Threadbare carpets up the stairs, Heavily stained carpets in room, poor decor, very cheap looking 'furniture' single room, small in area size, small single bed. You could feel the springs through the thin mattress, dingy. Complained and were directed to a basement room, similar carpet state, larger bed, similar mattress, even dingier. Web site states 'our newly refurbished rooms tastefully decorated to high standard'. I really do not know when that was written. I cannot comment on the staff apart from the male recepionist who tried his best to persuade my wife to stay with the threat of a cancellation feeI if she didn't occupy the room. ( fee taken from credit card!) I would not recommend this hotel for whatever reason to anyone I knew, probably the worst hotel I have had the misfourtune to enter.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: WBridgfordExpat
Reviews.Content: The so-called double room we were allocated was smaller than a shipâ€™s cabin with absolutely nowhere to put our luggage. The bed, which was not a double but a three-quarter, was crammed into the window recess with no room to move around it. The management insisted that this was a full-sized double which it most certainly was not I think it was what is commonly known as a three-quarter bed. There was no drawer space and the apology for a wardrobe was rendered inaccessible because our luggage blocked it. No bed light so had to switch off light at door and negotiate way back to bed in dark - not easy climbing over luggage etc. The â€œen suiteâ€� shower/toilet was also minute, the door skimmed the loo so that you had to flatten yourself against it or to climb over the toilet bowl to gain entrance, trying to get out again was another problem. On the whole the place was clean enough, the staff friendly, and the breakfast quite good, although the breakfast room is too small for the amount of guests they accommodate and people are queuing on the staircases waiting for others to finish. We wonâ€™t stay again. We do like that area and we had stayed at the Cavendish some time ago when the place was owned by two lovely Welsh ladies so we were very disappointed to find the service and amenities had declined to such an extent. There are plenty of other places on that stretch of road where the facilities are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler34
Reviews.Content: Standing in the middle of the cabin room, I could touch all of the walls without moving my feet. Bathroom was also tiny. Room and bathroom combined for roughly 6 square meters. TV was high on the wall, so you couldn't see it because of the drastic angle. The patio area was overgrown with weeds, and there was a layer of mold a few centimeters thick on the bathroom vent. Small, dank, dirty, and disgusting... Need I say more for the worst Hotel in the World? 3 Stars??? Are you kidding me? It would be a stretch to call this a 1 star! I would've rather stayed in a dormitory hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - all a bad dream”
Reviews.Author: Chismb
Reviews.Content: Business stay - booked into this Cavendish by mistake. Although only single occupancy I was charged full family room rate for the only room left. Decor is threadbare carpets, peeling paint and rickety 30 year old units. Wifi in my ground floor room didnt work & access to room was through a maze of coridoors & stairs past propped up mattresses in halls. Checked out at first light to find a cafe - never again!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Gowerstreet ...”
Reviews.Author: jan1245
Reviews.Content: The good news: there is no way of falling out of the bed, as there is no space left over to do so. My room (including bathroom) was smaller than my bathroom at home, and believe me, I do not have a big bathroom. Also good: nobody will be able to look into your room, as the curtains cannot be moved. And the free Wifi was free indeed; Free of access. Positive: kind person behind the reception / breakfast ok / many towels in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Never again not if they paid me!”
Reviews.Author: 186338JBond
Reviews.Content: This was one of those nightmares they make movies about. Be very clear that there are two Cavendishe's. I stayed at the 75 Gower location. The pictures on their web site are from 40 years ago and they haven't replace a thing since then. I had the choice of a 3rd floor walkup or the basement, I chose the basement. WiFi didn't work so no calls or emailing from the room. The shower was a pipe that water dribbled out of, I'm serious. They have decided that acting sympathetic is a substitute for doing anything. The carpets are manky and my asthma was triggered. If you know someone you despise, give them a free night at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT NOT WORTH A RETURN VISIT”
Reviews.Author: jules186311
Reviews.Content: The first impression was positive as the chap on reception was absolutely lovely and really helpful. We had the choice of a third floor room ( no lift ) or a room on the lower ground floor so opted for the latter. The outlook was of the hotel boiler room. The room seemed clean and adequate although very small and the carpet on the stairs to the room and to the dining rom was somewhat dangerous as it was threadbare. Breakfast was a huge disappointment. We had hardly sat down before the waitress pounced on us to take the order for our cooked breakfast and then it appeared before we had any time to eat any cereal, grapefruit etc or even get a hot drink. The breakfast was extremely poor. One very small sausage, one cold rasher of bacon, half a tomato and a fried egg...on cold plates too !! I stripped the beds before we left and really wished I hadn't because had I seen the stains on the mattress before I slept in the bed , I never would have. Â£105 for one night for two people. Very overpriced for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep is not on the agenda...”
Reviews.Author: Oddster
Reviews.Content: Let's be clear..... this is not the The Cavendish London on Jermyn Street.... ....and the only reason this hotel gets a reasonable rating on this site is because people are mistakenly reviewing the wrong hotel. This is not a 4 star hotel..... at best I would award 1.5.... On their website, they state: "Our newly refurbished rooms have been tastefully decorated to a high standard by well known hotel designer Wendy Purser-Horne of Buchanan Associates" Maybe so, but was this in 1940? I am a regular hotel user in London and found the following at this hotel: cons: 1) Tiny, tired bedrooms - marks on walls, stained carpets 2) Paper thin walls and windows - very noisy, both from traffic and neighbours 3) Uncomfortable bed 4) Pipes making horrendous noises all night 5) Air-raid-esque fire alarm went off at 05:30 - nearly knocked myself out falling out of bed! I am sure breakfast may have only have been quiet due to numerous heart attacks. pros: 1) Courteous staff 2) Generally clean 3) Breakfast was ok All in all, not a place to stay if you need to be conscious the following day. Maybe a consideration if you're out for a heavy evening on the pop, and you can get a room for <Â£50!!! The normal rates are just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best deal in town, located close to Baker Street - which is a plus”
Reviews.Author: TBuzz
Reviews.Content: Personally I didn't face too many problems at the hotel - but I did run into a couple of others who did. However, the problems were more administrative and logistical in nature. The quality of lodgings weren't inherently despicable in any way. The tariff in comparison to the size of the room was on the higher side. The staff was friendly and tried hard to be helpful. Not bad - if you have few other options !

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Lanners_G
Reviews.Content: This stay was a present from my parents for my 21st Birthday present. We booked the Cavendish on Gower Street after looking at the photos online thinking it looked a nice little place to stay - how wrong were we?? We arrived around 1pm and upon arrival they took payment for both nights stay from my card. We walked up 3 flights of stairs and when we got to our room the key card would not work! We then had to go back down for Reception for them to re-register the key. When we entered the room we just stood in disbelief. To say the room was small would be an understatement!! The whole room was filthy; the bed linen, the carpets, the walls were black and the bed was NOT a double - it was more of a small 3/4 bed!! The tea and coffee facilites were poor and the kettle's electricity test had not been done since 2007!! After deciding that there was no way we could stay here, we went back down to Reception to tell them we weren't happy and asked for a full refund - we were then told that they could only give us half of the money back! After arguing with them for 10 minutes, we gave up and accepted. My advice is DO NOT stay at this hotel, it is not 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you use the safe in the corner of the wardrobe that you are not informed about upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: denise_sharratt
Reviews.Content: The hotel appeared to offer all we wanted for our weekend in London until we returned back to our room on the Saturday after a full day of sightseeing to discover that my money had been stolen, passports and cards were left. As there was no evidence of a breakin I can only conclude it was stolen by somone with access to a key card! Two weeks later I am still awaiting a response from management.

Reviews.Title: “UNCLEAN”
Reviews.Author: AnnTea
Reviews.Content: The room was not clean: showerhead was so gunked up, water sprayed every which way when the nozzle was turned on. Wiped down the bathroom counter with a napkin that I soaped up with the bar soap in the room, and the filth/dirt/dust that came up was utterly disgusting. The slight beginnings of mold were starting to form in the toilet, and when I checked over the mattress, I saw an old blood stain that was on the bottom side of the mattress. The mattress itself was long overdue for being replaced; it was unbelievable how comfortable it was. Hotel staff was friendly - that's really the only nice thing I can say.

Reviews.Title: “a major scandal this hotel has invented its own 4 star rating!!”
Reviews.Author: Veryhorrified
Reviews.Content: i had to represent my company in finding a good hotel in central london, for a visiting compuer engineer, and trusted, wrongly, the star rating of hotels on websites. this one claimed to be 145GBPounds per night, reduced to 95 and 85. the truth was that this was another 2 or 3 star at best hotel, and not 4 star of anything...... when challenged about this after the engineer's stay, the staff the rating was the management's own..... are there not laws about this? find another hotel if you read this, and perhaps teach them to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “BED AND (VERY SMALL) BREAKFAST - NOT 4 STAR!”
Reviews.Author: emilyjade
Reviews.Content: I would call this hotel at best a guest house or B&B but definately not a 4 star hotel! The shower head fell off and hit my husband on the head the minute he used it. The door to the ensuite facilities was opaque and see through which obviously did not provide any privacy!! The firniture was tatty. The full english breakfast would not not have been enough for my 2 year old grandson i.e 1 rasher, 1 sausage, 1 tiny egg, 1/2 a tomatoe and about 10 baked beans!! We were expecting 4 star but got B&B we were very disappointed. That cost me Â£106 - never again. I dont understand why they are allowed to rate themselves 4 star - there should be a law against it!!

Reviews.Title: “The noise from the road kept the bed bugs away”
Reviews.Author: renwater
Reviews.Content: Good grief, I new I was in a bad hotel when they gave me my door key that was split and taped up. I was unfortunate enough to be allocated a lower ground floor. It was small, the carpet was stained but thankfully not as stained as the duvet......or the pillows. There was good mobile reception as I immediately tried to find another hotel but to my horror there was nothing avaiaqble close to Euston. i tried to have a shower but I could not get a decent flow of water, but to be honest if there had been decent pressure I think the shower head would have come off the wall. `it was in a bad way. i went to bed, fearing bed bugs. I did not see any, I think the noise of the road kept them at bay. I got through the night, had a small breakfast. I wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Dire and with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: First, don't get caught that this hotel is positioned to be confused with another one of the same name in Mayfair! I had an "Executive Double". The place has a stranage transitory aire, my room had nice garden view but the carpet was dirty, no where to sit comfortably, dusty and tatty table, cramped shower, filthy mugs. But this was the good bit - after returning from my evening function and trying to sleep I awoke itching - to my horror on the pillow saw 2 flat bugs and caught one. That was the end of my sleep. Early in the morning I checked out but the hotel staff on reception had so little understanding of English it was hard to communicate. I left a letter for manager and then finally managed to speak with him by phone to explain why I would not be paying my Â£150! He accepted the poor experience and said he would call their contracted cleansing firm in. Even apart from the bugs this place is very bad value indeed and should be avoided. Its a disaster zone.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst "hotel" I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Loz1982
Reviews.Content: The Cavendish "Hotel" is definately not a four-star Hotel, a guest house or B&B at best. After trawling through the web this was the cheapest acommodation in the area so we decided to take a punt. The room was on the very top floor at the back, ideal for minimal traffic noise but a killer on the old legs. Breakfast was nice, allbeit a bit of a small portion but there are other things to eat such as cereals and fruit. The TV was disappointing; I was expecting Sky as the website stated, instead getting terrestrial with all the channels jumbled up in order. The sink in the bathroom had a huge crack running all the way through it; how the water stayed in the sink is a bit of a mystery. Probably the best bit of the stay was the free broadband, which entertained me when there was nothing on TV, and the close proximity to Goodge Street tube station.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap, bed-for-the-night kind of place, certainly not 4 star. Who rates these things?”
Reviews.Author: mellotron
Reviews.Content: I had a tiny room; admittedly there must be better ones, but I suspect none of them have carpets. Certainly the room above me did at least have a chair - I know this because I could hear it scraping across the floor as the occupants tried to navigate around. I was wary of the breakfast sausage, but I don't think it had any dodgy meat in it, as I don't think there was any meat in it at all. I took out some packs of mild cheddar and an apple so I could have a tasteless snack later on. Funniest bit was the garden - don't believe the photos - it was particularly unkempt - empty cans and fag ends galore. There was one unopened can of Fosters in a Sainsburys bag half full of rainwater on my peeling painted windowsill. My minibar perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “what a rip off !”
Reviews.Author: vjo38
Reviews.Content: firstly , don't stay there . if you have booked , unbook it . my room was poky and tatty . the rates they charge are a joke . it is not 4 star - two star at best . i have slept in better tents .

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there!”
Reviews.Author: MoscowKunder
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for two nights. You could say that the room was enough for two people and warm but I should argue that other faults can't compensate for its 'dignities', if you can name it as such. We were astonished to see: 1. small rooms 2. awful water pressure (toilet included) 3. very bad smell 4. dirty blankets and carpets 5. the glass bathroom door in our room was opposite our pillows, so every time one of us needed it at night another one woke up because of lights on! 6. very poor breakfast 7. very expensive! *Be attentive and cancel your booking two days earlier or when you fill in the form at the reception, mark 'pay by cash' but not 'pay by credit card' - so that they won't be able to withdraw money from your account! Resolution: make Indians give the place only two stars and force them to reduce the price!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cavendish on Bloomsbury is an IN-DECENT one”
Reviews.Author: abcd1234NewYork
Reviews.Content: 1. They charged me twice on my credit card before I even checked-in 2. The room is small and the bedsheet is dirty 3. When I notified them of my checking-out the hotel a few days earlier than my original reservation 24 hours in advance, they charged me an extra night for that even if they told me earlier that no extra charge if it is notified 24 hours in advance 4. During my check-in, I saw a lady with 2 children were complaining about extra charge as well.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL CAVENDISH BLOOMSBURY NOT CAVENDISH HOTEL CENTRAL LONDON”
Reviews.Author: kevjane
Reviews.Content: I admit I booked this hotel based upon great reviews but did not realise there is two "CAVENDISH" hotels one in gower street bloomsbury and one in central london near picadily. Guess what i booked bloomsbury what a dissapointment i had seen the photo's on tripadvisor and when we arrived i knew something was wrong. But we checked in and took a look around this hotel is a certainly in the budget class we paid Â£275 for 2 nights b&b NOT a budget room rate. At the time i booked i thought that was a great deal thinking we had booked the other CAVENDISH. The room was OK being down a narrow coridoor with old mattreses propt up against the wall it is more suited to being a guesthouse than a hotel. In fact everything was just about ok. The breakfast was budget also with 1egg 1 sausauge 1 rasher of bacon and 1 slice of toast with half a tomato and around a dozen baked beans per person and the dining room was to small having to wait for a table. The hotel was not a disaster just disapointing for the price if we had paid Â£150 ish we would have been happy for london but we booked in a hurry and made a mistake PLEASE CHECK YOU HAVE THE RIGHT HOTEL BEFOR YOU BOOK

Reviews.Title: “Washing and sleeping are all you can hope to achieve in your room. Neither was a comfortable experience.”
Reviews.Author: bobSomerset
Reviews.Content: This hotel is generally tired and down-at-heel. All carpets are threadbare and paintwork scuffed. On a mild september day, the entire hotel was hot and humid. Seeing my single room, I assumed that I had been allocated a cabin room in error. I checked with reception and was told that, no cabin rooms are even smaller. I felt humbled by the thought that others must be suffering so much. The shower room was recently decorated but so lillipultian was its aspect that I could exit it only by pressing myself against the wall opposite the door: otherwise my body impeded its (inward) opening. The bedroom walls were a scuffed patchwork of soiled paint and unsanded filler. It was possible to view the TV only from the bed, which added unwelcome hours of exposure to its too-thin mattress and negligible pillow. I fled the room and spent the evening aimlessly walking the streets until tired enough to return and sleep. In the morning, Breakfast was well-cooked and the serving staff were polite and helpful. I would stay here again only if there were no conceivable alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just what we were looking for, good price, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissedagain
Reviews.Content: For what we paid we couldn't expect more from this hotel. The room was clean, the staff pleasant and breakfast was good. We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny cramped rooms, with poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: JeevesCostadelSol
Reviews.Content: The location, near the West End, University of London, and the City, is the only good thing about this hotel. The stair carpet is threadbare, the single room I had was tiny and cramped, the safe had been left locked by the previous occupant, so could not be used, there is no air-conditioning, so on a hot August night, I wanted to open the windows. However, there was an unopenable blind between the two levels of glazing, so this wasn't possible. As the location is very noisy, perhaps this was fortunate. There was a small desk-top fan as the only means of making the room tolerable for sleeping. The carpet was grubby and the wardrobe had a very few assorted dry cleaners' hangers. The shower produced a slow trickle of water, scarcely enough for a wash. The breakfast was well cooked but a single egg, single sausage, and single rasher of bacon hardly constituted a 'full English breakfast'. The hotel claims to have refurbished their rooms - one shudders to think how bad they must have been previously!

Reviews.Title: “Warning- avoid this hovel”
Reviews.Author: MorningstarTS
Reviews.Content: Shocking. A room that has to be seen to be believed. Kind of the opposite of a tardis - smaller inside than outside. No room to move. Shower room even more useless. If small is your bag though then one thing you will be delighted with will be the full english breakfast - one rasher of bacon , a sausage, an egg and (honestly) 11 baked beans ! Toast arrived 10 minutes before meal or ten minutes after meal as only one poor waitress for 30 people- couples queing out into the corridors to get a seat. You end up sharinga table - Very hot room - no satelite TV even though it says there is. In 35 years of travel this is THE worst hotel we have ever stayed in - not even a base - avoid like the proverbial plague - Tom and Maria

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EamonK
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel. The room was in a 2nd floor and no lift so I had to lift my lyggage and laptop myself. When I reached the room, I have no words to describe it. was not .....the size of a midget!!. I had to jump over my luggage to get to the tiny bed....head and feet in the wall, bathroom , tiny, and water poor. I had to get out of my bedroom as soon as possible as I felt absolutely claustraphobic. The towels with hole.....so quality in general very poor. Only the location is good but does not compensate! Overall it was an appaling hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I feel ripped off”
Reviews.Author: RDCWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Really cross with Cavendish hotel, have stayed there before and had large double room at the back which I purposefully requested again as it is much quieter. On arrival we were allocated a TINY box room which was at the front over looking Gower street, very noisy and boiling hot. When I complained we were moved to sister hotel The Langland just down the road. There the room was bigger and at the back but grubby and smelly. There were doors banging all night as people came and went as we were near reception and had very little sleep. For the money I think both hotels offer poor service and facilities and we will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Mide
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2008 for 1 night for a business trip. I chose it mainly because of its location, which is excellent. Short walk from Euston or Warren Street, it is located just opposite the large Waterstones bookshop in a row of terraced hotels. My room was located right behind reception which I was a bit worried about. The room itself was fine, although I can't understand why they put up a prefab toilet and shower room, which was very small. Flat screen TV on wall was OK although a bit high up and a bit small for the distance the bed was away. Double bed was clean and comfortable. Cooked breakfast was shall we say 'minimal' but was very nice all the same. The only real problem I had apart from the weird bathroom, was the noise. I got woken up at about 4am by people moving around outside the door, but I guess you're bound to get this wherever you stay to a certain extent. It wasn't terrible noise but because I'm a light sleeper, it did wake me up. Tea and coffee facilities good. Felt safe and secure and felt the hotel was absolutely fine for a night or two. Main thing is the location I'd say.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: CornwallSweetie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay. Can only give praise to the hotel and staff. Booked late so had to take a double room, which for a few extra pounds was well worth it. Room clean and tidy, and at the back so extremely quite. Had a wonderful nights sleep awoken in the morning by the smell of cooking bacon (Bliss). Breakfast very nice and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Shayna1161
Reviews.Content: The location is great Walking distance from the tube. However the rooms are tiny. They have two sizes for Double Rooms Small and Large The small is really tiny ... no space to move around The larger one is fine ... So call and make sure that u r getting the one with the sofa .. The other room can't fit in a sofa ... We had to wrestle and got ourselves into the larger one. Our friends were staying at the Regent (next door). Much better rooms for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “good location and price”
Reviews.Author: anne72
Reviews.Content: 2 minutes walk from the british museum and easy access to west end. so location is great. recent refurb by the look of things and the room was clean and bathroom newish. room was a triple i.e. twin with campbed so was a bit cramped. we paid Â£145 which seemed reasonable value for london! room however was stifling hot. on third floor with small sash window. unfortunately it was hottest weekend of trhe year. think carefully if you visit in summer. breakfast was mediocre. small portions even for us girls and service was questionable. would stay again though if i wanted cheap(ish) stay in good location and a small brekkie-maybe only in winter though!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Content: A truly dreadful hotel. The room was hardly bigger than the uncomfortable foam double bed. The temperature was sweltering - despite it not being particularly warm outside. The window could not be left open as the traffic noise was so loud. The trucks thundering past made the sash windows rattle. I have never been in a hotel room (despite back-packing around the world) that I have been afraid to close my eyes in. I implore you - STAY AWAY. Definately not worth the Â£145 that the company I work for, paid for my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: TravelgrannySydney
Reviews.Content: I decided to try this hotel in spite of mixed reviews because all the others nearby and of similar price had consistently bad reviews. I was cosy but not suffocated, comfortable and quiet. My single room had double glazing with blinds enclosed, so I never worked out how to look outside. Gower Street was reasonably close to St Pancras for the Eurostar. I took a taxi with my 2 suitcases, backpack and walking stick - tube or bus would have been easy without the baggage. When they saw me, they put me on the first floor thank goodness. The stairs are very steep. I had just enough room to move my suitcases around and repack. Breakfast was bountiful and early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy place”
Reviews.Author: waterbutt
Reviews.Content: It is located at a very convenient spot. Was very clean and the lobby was lavender-scented. It might be tiny and there aren't any lifts (had a terrible time dragging my luggages up and down the stairs) but i find it rather cosy. Nice reception staff and breakfast was delicious. Although the price is a little steep for a b&b, i wld definitely come back to this b&b again.

Reviews.Title: “It has character!”
Reviews.Author: AshaDasha
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It's close to tube stops and the British Museum, and the Beatles stayed there for chrissakes! All of the other complaints here are valid, I'm sure, but also just part of the aging, authentic house that it is. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: beatles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cavendish for a two night break at the beginning of December 2007. The London trip was a 40th birthday present from my husband and we took in the sights of London visited he Terracotta Army Exhibition and had a great meal at Fifteen - Jamie Oliver's. The Hotel was okay it had everything you needed it was clean airy and light. The bathroom looked as though it was a new suite. The room was a great size the bathroom was okay but a little small but both were very clean and well presented. Would we stay here again - yes we would. We were shocked to read the other reviews we did not have a bad experience at all. Our room did not look over the main road but to the back of the property so it was not as noisy. But what can you expect from London every street is a main steet traffic is continous as it is a big City. London is not the kind of place for a nice relaxing break it does not lend it self to that in my opinion. The breakfast was fine you could have a full english or anything from the buffet table. On the first morning I just wanted sonething light - poached eggs and tomatoe which was not a problem. The staff were very welcoming the receptionist even ordered us a taxi and gave us a call up to our room when it arrived. Our London trip was a great experience and we would definatley go back to the Hotel Cavendish. We stayed in room 208 that had a good view of the BT Tower with its colourful display of lights in the evening. Do not rule out this hotel for the price we paid and the great location only a ten - fifteen minute walk into Covent garden & The British Musuem we felt it was worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Great Disaster”
Reviews.Author: young_couple_holiday
Reviews.Content: This is the most terrible hotel I have ever visited. First of all, no ventilation is available at the hotel, the smell is so disgusting that I can hardly breath well. When we entered the room, you can't believe that the floor is tilted by 20 degree, that means the floor is not flat land, but is a slope. I feel dizzy instantly. Then, I would like to take a rest on the bed, which lead us to another terrible part. The structure of the bed is so fragile and you won't dare to sleep on it. Of course, no need to mention that the single layer of the window will give yiou a feel that the double-deck buses are just next to you. It costs us 105 pounds per nite. But, I have to say that I won't enter this hotel again even if it's free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “like sleeping outside”
Reviews.Author: tracy50
Reviews.Content: hi all, went for the weekend with my husband for our 10th wedding anniversary and to meet some friends ,checked in at 8.30 pm got changed and went for a meal ( which was fantastic). came back for 11pm got in bed and thought the window was open because of the motorway- like traffic noise and serious draught,went to shut ut but to my suprise it was allready shut, there was a 2 inch gap at the bottom of the window and when its middle of november in london it is quite cold.i went down to reception to asked to be moved at 12.30AM it was unbearable even my husband couldnt sleep and he can sleep on a clothes line.and guess what,full.i told him i need movin to another hotel then and they were very understandingthey moved us to one near kings cross in a taxi.nearly same room on a busy road but quiet and draught free. overall good staff ,very helpfull, great location and very clean but needs the windowssorting or some secondary glazing. if you are booking good look with the room! cause its a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Glad It Was Just One Night”
Reviews.Author: Rose_thea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the cavendish for one night on 8/11 and booked through the hotel website @95gbp which is pretty good for the location.We (me and husband) arrived late at nigh -1 am- and the guy at reception was friendly and nice to us . So far so good. Room was on 2nd floor without lift but no problem there cause luckily our bags were not heavy altough big.. When I entered the room I was pretty shocked by its size ! no room to open or just place the suitcases and the smallest double bed I've ever seen was situated against the wall with the only window . OK, we just needed a place to rest for a few hours but the worst had yet to come. The window had no double glazing and had a gap in it that let (very) cold air blowing over the two of us the entire time. Trucks roaring and speeeding down the outside road from 6:00 in the morning were the icing on the cake. I'm glad I didn't need to go to the toilet in the middle of the night cause i should have climbed over my husband to get out of bed! We obviously got up quite early and manage to have a shower in the minuscule cubicle called bathroom .My overall impression was of a general grubbiness and I didnt like it at all. In the stairs we was greeted by the unappealing smell of food (cooked breakfast??) which, altough included in the price, we decided to skip . A place where you can't even rest properly is just not worth the effort, is it? Needless to say we would not come back

Reviews.Title: “Service? What service.”
Reviews.Author: dukejt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cavendish for an anniversary theatre break. The location of the cavendish was superb and was in easy walking distance to theatreland. The hotel itself was clean and well presented. However, the problems started as soon as we arrived. The room was decorated to a good standard and was clean but this seemed to mask the poor amenities. Firstly, the new posh flatscreen lcd t.v was green and therefore unwatchable. We complained to the front desk and the receptionist came up to see for himself. He did not try to fix it apart from 'I'll let the manager know.' After arriving back from a great evening at the theatre I decided to have a shower only to find that it literally dribbled water. It would have taken an age to have washed. Again, I told the night receptionsit and he said, 'There is nothing I can do until the morning.' Fair Enough. The next morning we had to catch the early train and tried to check out. I complained that the t.v and shower did not work, the receptionist said there was nothing he could do as I did not pay full price for the room as I booked through Hotels.com. If I had known that getting a discount meant that I could not have used the t.v or shower, I would have paid full price! I asked if the manager would phone me, which he never did. I phoned again, no response, tried again, no response. In the end I called the Hotel 13 times over a ten day period! In the end the receptionist said that the manager did not want to speak to me. I found this absolutely disgusting. All I wanted was an apology, instead I was brushed off by the gutless manager. After writing to the managing director I received a brief phone call telling me I could have a 30 pound refund. This however, did little to change the bitter taste this whole episode left.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: ThreeFromVancouver
Reviews.Content: ...the room we stayed in (LG1) was very small for three people. It was between the breakfast room and the kitchen (which started at 06:30 every morning) so no sleeping in. Perhaps they shouldn't even rent out that room. The staff and service was okay. And things seemed reasonably clean. No lift, so if you have bags, you will have to take them up and down some of the smallest steps we ran into. Venere ended up making two identical reservations for the hotel (which they picked up on before we arrived).

Reviews.Title: “Noiseiest Hotel I've ever stayed in (and I've been to a few)”
Reviews.Author: RamblinRawly
Reviews.Content: On checking in I was initially impressed by the location but once we returned in the evening the problems became apparent. No double glazing and rotten windows and shutters whose hinges had come away from the wall, and could easily fall on a less observant guest's head, so no effective sound insulation. Consequently our attempts at sleep were accompanied by the sounds of numerous heavy goods vehicles using the very busy Gower steet outside, honestly it sounded as though the windows were wide open. Just thinking about it is making me tired. We greeted the morning ready for absolutely nothing with our eyes smarting from lack of sleep. I told recdeption about these problems and was met with polite and well practiced indifference (and no offer of a refund of any sort). Maybe the rooms at the back are better, but to be on the safe side I'd advise steering clear

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Paulista1977
Reviews.Content: A simple good hotel in Central London. For the price, the hotel is honest: tiny single rooms. Best feature: service. Very efficient and really pleasant staff. They will try to help you with anything you need. Wifi. Very good deal. I stayed here twice and will ceratinly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms. Good Service. My room was particularily small but perfect for one. Definetly would recomend making sure you get a bigger room, if traveling with others. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic? Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: CEEH
Reviews.Content: I had been to Hotel Cavendish before the renovations, back when it was owned by a very erratic, messy yet enthusiastic person. Back then the rooms were not exactly up to par -- the breakfast room was not really clean, my room had bare walls and a window that wouldn't shut properly -- but the rates reflected this quality and frankly, the location could hardly be better. I decided to book the same hotel for a business trip to London. I checked their Web site and was encouraged by pretty pictures of modern rooms. I was a litle surprised that such a small hotel, with small rooms to begin with could turn into the pretty pictures on the site. Considering that the rates had tripled (yes, tripled), I figured the quality had also tripled. I booked a single room. On arrival it was clear that the hotel had been renovated. Clean carpets, bright lights, even a front desk. Though the heaters were working full blast making it unbarably hot, I felt reassured that I had made the right choice. Then I was shown to my room #202. The door opened onto a very narrow and long entrance -- the word narrow isn't strong enough. Its width was no larger than the distance from one outstretched arm to the other outstretched elbow. And I am a short person. Towards the end of this entrance, a very narrow desk (barely wider than a laptop). At the end of it, a single bed squeezed against a wall with a window. No room on either side of the bed for lamps or table. In short, it really felt like I was in a sleeper cabin in an old fashion train. I had to put my bag sideways on the floor for it to fit, and could only open it with difficulty. I sat on the bed and realized immediately that the window didn't shut properly. I wondered if this was the same room I had had in the past...at about 2 in the morning, I was woken up by a man on the street below having a conversation on his cell phone. He was planning some kind of a party with his friends. I felt like I was in the street with him. I would not recommend this hotel, particularly considering the high rates. Even its great location isn't worth it. There are many other B&Bs on that street. Note of warning: do *not* ask them to book you a taxi. They use a private taxi who will overcharge you. My driver was extremely reckless and almost got into an accident before being pulled over by the police. When I refused to pay the fare, the driver threatened that he would not return my bag. Definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PhxMan500
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience. The staff was friendly, the area was quite while still close to everything, the room was clean, the breakfast was excellent. The only thing preventing me from rating this a perfect excellent is the false fire alarm going off 3 out of 6 mornings! Thank goodness I have a healthy heart, because the alarm nearly gave me a heart attack all 3 mornings.

Reviews.Title: “best choice!”
Reviews.Author: alessia.f
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from London, where I spent a weekend with a friend. Everybody was saying hotels in London are expensive, with tiny dirty rooms, so I was kind of worried. I made the reservation for the Cavendish hotel through the website Venere.com and I had no problems at all with both the website and the hotel. This small hotel is in a very good location, in a quiet street in the center of London, in short walking distance from the British Museum and from several tube and bus stops. The room had a decent size, not huge, but big enough, the bed was big, we could also have twin beds that I asked in the notes, 'cause it didn't look available in the automatic form for the request. The bathroom was tiny, with only shower, but you could easily move inside and it was really clean, like all the rest of the room which appeared to be recently renewed. Complete english breakfast was included in the price and served in a nice and clean room, not bad, even if I thought they missed some fresh sweets or at least some cookies. The only con is the lack of a lift, we were on the 3rd (and last) floor, and hopefully our luggage wasn't that heavy! Globally a very good choice, not cheap (Â£95 per day for a double room) but not really expensive for London and for the location. Staff very kind! I'll go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: katie1978
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was told that I would be staying "next door" for the first night. No apology or anything! The hotel manager accompanied me 5 minutes down the street (i.e. not next door at all!) to another hotel. There, he proceeded to have an argument with the woman at that hotel before showing me to a room. I don't recall the name of this other hotel. The room was a reasonable size but the floor was dirty. I kept stepping on bits of food (or something). There was nowhere to hang my clothes, which were drenched from the rain. The next morning when I returned to the Hotel Cavendish, my room wasn't ready, but I was able to leave my case there. I returned later and they kept saying it'd be ready in "15 minutes" but this happened several times and it was about 3pm before I got in there. When I finally got in the room at the Hotel Cavendish, it was really nice. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom amazing (I would say luxury!!) and there was a small flatscreen TV above the bed. Not a huge room, but good for the price. The breakfast was OK. All in all, the inefficient service spoilt this stay a little. I would recommend the rooms highly but, if they overbook, you may end up at a horrible hotel down the road...

Reviews.Title: “Excessive road noise, but nice location”
Reviews.Author: triposte
Reviews.Content: Avoid any room at the front of this hotel. The road noise is excessive as Gower Street is a busy road. Good central location. Hotel staff were pleasant, good breakfast and nice refurbishment. Just take your ear plugs... Apparently, they cannot put in sound insulation into this listed building. However, I looked at the hotels either side and they has clearly done so.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: JB337
Reviews.Content: Recently spent one night here with 3 friends in a quad room (approx 100 pounds for the room, incl full English breakfast). Hotel renovations are obvious-- it just smells "new" when you walk in (in a pleasant way). Everything looks new and clean, decor is fine. Reception to the right just as you come in the door was adequate and comfortable. We arrived later than expected thanks to a transportation problem, and the reception clerk was very friendly and helpful with recommending restaurants still open at the late hour. Room was large with one king and one double bed, and decent sized bathroom ensuite (shower only). Flat screen TV, fireplace, desk with kettle/coffee/tea/shortbread, armoire. Very very clean, beds were comfortable. We were on the ground floor at the street, but noise was not an issue. The only complaint about the room was that the door had to be slammed to fully close. Otherwise it would not lock. Breakfast was average, but selection was good, and there was plenty of food, even toward the end of the breakfast period. Full English was included in our room price. Location was fantastic. Close to Goodge St and Euston Square tube stops. Easy walk to Soho. A block from the London University. Close to Regent's Park, a great place for a run or walk. It appears that the new management has certainly gotten things under control. Great value, great place to stay in an expensive city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Laptop got stolen, no hot water and unreliable Hotelmanager”
Reviews.Author: clooner
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in May 2006 for two (2) weeks. I can absolutely sign and underline the former reviews. If you stay only for a weekend, you might not realise all the problems of think, it is just a temporay problem as the manager tries to explains it. BUT.. if you stay longer, you reckon, that the Hotelmanager keeps telling the same story to each complaining guest and acts as if this guest is the first one complaining about missing hot water. After a few nights my laptop got stolen and I found it hidden under the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Chaos rules”
Reviews.Author: Amum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under new management, and while they've remodelled the building, they've also kind of lost control of the basics. For instance, I discovered that my room had no toilet paper in the most inconvenient possible way. There were no drapes or blinds on the windows, which is both a privacy issue, and makes it harder to sleep off your jet lag. The office gave the impression of complete administrative chaos, an impression confirmed when I got back home, and found that my credit card had been charged for an extra day -- I'm still trying to resolve this problem, and they haven't gotten back to me on it. (That one's a big deal -- getting the billing right is something you just have to do.) Oh, and the reservation confirmation promises TVs and phones in the rooms, and that certainly wasn't true of mine.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: delltas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in late June and found the hotel to be better than our expectations. It's proximity to the British Museum was a big plus for us. The rooms have all been recently refurbished and are bright and modern, and while not 100% done, we had everything we wanted. The beds are really comfortable and the flat screen tv was great for watching the world cup soccer matches. The in room safes were fitted during our stay. The staff were friendly and very efficient, especially the waitress at breakfast. We were given a tour of the new reception area which was almost complete and looks stunning. The narrow old stairs down to the breakfast room were the only negative for us. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: allen133
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several European hotels, and this was our second visit to Hotel Cavendish. Hotel Cavendish is a great hotel for price. It's not the Ritz, but the new management has done a great job re-furbishing the place. Compared to a year ago, the place is almost unrecognizable. The rooms have been completly updated. New carpet, paint, furniture, flat screen t.v.s . . . and most (maybe all) now have ensuite bathrooms! We had a great visit, and would definately return. I think most of the problems other travelers reported were related to the management changes and the heavy remodeling. When we were there (June 10-13) they were still working on the reception, but the new rooms, hallways and breakfast room were all up and running. They were very close to being completely finished. I can't wait to go back and see the entire place re-done. In my opinion the new management has done a fabulous job!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: AMC19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavendish hotel while attending a conference at the nearby Birkbeck college recently, which was a mixed experience... On the plus side: 1. The rooms have been refurbished recently and as a result are clean and smart. 2. The ensuite bathrooms, though very small, are immaculate, and definately a plus as many London hotel rooms at this price have shared facilities. 3. The price is very good for London. 4. The location is convenient. On the down side: 1. There is no proper reception area at the moment (though I believe one is being put in the new wing next door) so I had to drag my bags about the hotel before managing to locate the manager to check in. 2. The manager kindly let me into 'my' room before the check in time, but when I got there somebody elses things were already in there - I had been given the wrong room. Previous reviews suggest that this has happened before, which raises issues about the security arrangements. 3. The 'full' English breakfast consisted of one egg, one slice of bacon and half a tomato - not very 'full' in my opinion! 4. There was no actual phone in the room, only a phone socket, and I was asked if I was going to want to watch telly - suggesting that if I said no, I would have been put in a room without one of these either! 5. The single room was very small, even by London standards. 6. The management/organisation seemed a little eratic and did not fill me with confidence, even though I did not have any major problems myself. All in all, this was not a bad place to stay and met my needs for the two nights I was there, but I think I would look around for somewhere else next time, as there were too many little niggles and incompetancies.

HotelInfo.Name: Cavendish Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 75 Gower Street | Bloomsbury, London WC1E 6HJ, England
